snippet: President Bashar al-Assad’s visit to a power plant in the capital, Damascus, came after consecutive days of deadly bombings in the heart of his power base.
abstract: Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad makes rare public appearance, visiting workers at electric station in Damascus; visit is likely meant to counter impression that Assad has become a leader in hiding following consecutive days of insurgent bombings in besieged capital.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: President Bashar al-Assad’s visit to a power plant in the capital, Damascus, came after consecutive days of deadly bombings in the heart of his power base.

headline.seo: Besieged Syrian Leader Assad Makes Rare Appearance
headline.main: Besieged Syrian Leader Makes Rare Public Appearance
headline.print_headline: Besieged Syrian Leader Makes Rare Public Appearance
